page.title: 05Famous People /contd.
page.content: Conversions to the almshouses took place in 1960; six were made into four now containing bed-sitting room, small kitchen and bathroom, and garden. {Travis Teversham,}Sawston's local historian was born in 1882 and educated at Sawston Infant School later going to Cambridge University where he obtained a Diploma in Agriculture. He taught in various schools and fought in the Army in the 1914-18 War. He recovered from tuberculosis in 1928 and became a guide at Sawston Hall. Still weak and unable to work, he studied nature and also wrote the History of Sawston in two volumes published in 1942 and 1947. His favourite pastimes were cricket, golf and listening to music. He died at the old age of 88 on May 2 1971.
